newsitem.title: Malta: Malta's prime minister concedes election defeat.
newsitem.headline: Malta's prime minister concedes election defeat.

text.p: Nationalist Party leader Edward Fenech Adami on Monday accepted the defeat of his government in Malta's general election, a party spokesman said.
"Dr Fenech Adami informed the president of Malta early this morning that he accepted the victory of the Labour Party," the spokesman told Reuters.
Labour earlier claimed victory after a campaign in which it pledged to abandon Malta's application to join the European Union and to scrap a highly unpopular value added tax.

"There are clear indications that there is a Labour victory and I want to reaffirm our intention to form a government for all the people of Malta," party leader Alfred Sant, 48, said on radio late on Sunday.
The Nationalist Party had a three-seat majority in the outgoing 65-member parliament.
